en: She suddenly fell silent.
She burst into anger.
She turned around suddenly.
All of a sudden, she began to laugh.
She burst into tears.
She burst out crying.
Suddenly she had a brilliant inspiration.
ko: 갑자기 걔한테 아주 좋은 아이디어가 떠올랐어.

en: She found pleasure in reading.
ko: 걔는 책 읽는 거에서 즐거움을 찾았어.

en: She indulged herself in reading.
She has a taste for reading.
She likes to read.
She teaches reading and writing.
She is a self-educated woman.
She went to the movies by herself.
She stayed here by herself.
She wears heavy makeup.
She has a sharp tongue.
She killed herself by taking poison.
ko: 걔는 독을 먹고 스스로 목숨을 끊었어.

en: She committed suicide by taking poison.
She was studying drama on a special scholarship.
ko: 걔는 특별 장학금을 받으면서 연극을 공부했어.

en: She has a special way of making bread.
ko: 걔는 빵 만드는 특별한 방법이 있어.

en: She is endowed with a special talent.
She slipped in crossing the road.
She was on the point of laughing at the clown's actions.
ko: 걔는 광대 짓을 보고 웃음이 터지기 직전이었어.

en: When she got lost, she wished she had followed his advice.
ko: 길을 잃었을 때 걔는 그의 조언을 들을걸 그랬다고 후회했어.

en: I am afraid she may have lost her way.
She lost her way.
She lost her way and on top of that it began to rain.
ko: 걔는 길을 잃은 데다가 비까지 오기 시작했어.

en: She cut me dead in the street.
ko: 걔는 길에서 나를 보고도 완전히 무시했어.

en: She ignored me even when she met me on the street.
ko: 걔는 길에서 마주쳐도 나를 아는 척도 안 했어.

en: She is well spoken of among her own sex.
She may or may not agree with us.
ko: 걔가 우리 의견에 동의할지 안 할지 모르겠어.

en: She keeps on making the same mistakes.
She made the same mistake again.
She gave up eating meat after reading a book about cruelty to animals.
ko: 걔는 동물 학대에 관한 책을 읽고 나서 고기를 안 먹기로 했어.

en: She kept on writing stories about animals.
ko: 걔는 계속 동물에 관한 이야기를 썼어.

en: She spoke out strongly against cruelty to animals.
ko: 걔는 동물 학대에 대해서 아주 강하게 반대했어.

en: She is gentle to animals.
She wrote a book about animals.
She went on working.
She kept on working.
She kept working.
She's always on the go.
She's tired from overwork.
She complains of headaches, and that very often.
ko: 걔는 머리가 아프다는 소리를 정말 자주 해.

en: She complained of a headache.
She complained of her headache.
She laid her head down on the pillow.
She lifted up her head and looked at him.
She held up her head.
She is a clear-headed.
She is as hardworking as she is bright.
She is out of her mind.
She has brains.
She appears to have a headache.
She is sharp.
She was up to her eyes grading the papers.
She may have known the answer.
She sometimes hesitates before answering.
I'm afraid she can't answer.
ko: 아무래도 대답을 못 할 것 같아요.

en: I think she can't answer.
She was puzzled, and she ran away from me.
She has moved house six times since she came here.
ko: 여기 온 이후로 이사를 여섯 번이나 했어요.

en: I took it for granted that she would come to our wedding.
ko: 당연히 우리 결혼식에 올 줄 알았어요.

en: She let him pay the bill as a matter of course.
She must have been rich in those days.
She told me how it was wrong to steal.
ko: 훔치는 게 왜 나쁜지 저한테 말해줬어요.

en: She is looking forward to going to the Tohoku district.
ko: 도호쿠 지방에 가는 걸 기대하고 있어요.

en: She called me up from Tokyo.
She was aware of the danger of the frozen road.
ko: 길이 얼어서 위험하다는 걸 알고 있었어요.

en: She kept the dining room warm in winter.
She kept the dining room warm in the winter.
She fell down and broke her left leg.
She held back her anger, and smiled graciously.
She was burning with anger.
She forgot about me in her anger.
Her voice was shaking with anger.
She was so angry that she could not speak.
ko: 너무 화가 나서 말도 안 나왔어요.

en: She was mad with anger.
She has a hot temper.
She is beside herself with rage.
She went out of the room in anger.
She spit out an angry reply.
She rang off angrily.
She stared me down with anger.
She fixed me with an angry stare.
She turned away in anger.
She broke the dish on purpose just to show her anger.
ko: 화가 났다는 걸 보여주려고 일부러 접시를 깼어요.

en: She must be angry.
She was angry. That is why she remained silent.
ko: 화가 나서 아무 말도 안 한 거예요.

en: She was angry, but she spoke with restraint.
She looked me angrily in the face.
She got angry.
She got mad.
She doesn't have to go to school on Saturday.
She is going to visit her grandmother on Saturday.
For all her efforts, she didn't succeed.
She pictured to herself imagined city life.
She left the country to get work in the town.
ko: 걔는 일자리 구하려고 시골을 떠나 도시로 갔어.

en: She was at her wit's end.
She saw many animals on the way.
She used to wash her hair before going to school.
ko: 걔는 학교 가기 전에 항상 머리를 감곤 했어.

en: She asked me whether she could use the telephone.
ko: 걔가 나한테 전화 좀 써도 되냐고 물어봤어.

en: She covered the mouthpiece of the phone with her hand.
She stood up to answer the phone.
She made me so angry on the telephone that I hung up on her.
ko: 전화로 너무 화나게 해서 그냥 끊어버렸어.

en: She started talking as soon as she got through.
She left her umbrella in the train.
She made room for an old women on the train.
She may have missed her train.
She stood there even after the train was out of sight.
ko: 기차가 안 보일 때까지 계속 거기 서 있었어.

en: She received the electricity bill today.
She turned out the light so as not to waste electricity.
She considered him extravagant with electricity.
ko: 걔는 그 사람이 전기를 낭비한다고 생각했어.

en: She thought that he was wasting electricity.
ko: 걔는 그 사람이 전기를 낭비하고 있다고 생각했어.

en: She found it dull living in the country.
She lived a quiet life in the country.
She leads a life of ease in the country.
She made for a rice field.
She has gone over to the other side.
She fell down and hurt her knee.
She was injured in a fall.
She killed an hour looking around the stores.
She killed time going around the shops.
Her eyes traveled over all the things in the shop.
She tried to get a tent at the shop, but she could not find the one she wanted.
ko: 가게에서 텐트를 사려고 했는데 원하는 걸 못 찾았어.

en: She won first prize in the exhibition.
She is a natural musician.
She's an absolute angel.
She is an angel of a girl.
It is no exaggeration to say that she is an angel.
It is believed that she is a genius.
She looked up at the ceiling.
She took advantage of the fine weather to paint the wall.
She looked at her flight of cranes hanging from the ceiling, which her brother Masahiro had hung there for her.
ko: 오빠 마사히로가 천장에 달아준 종이학들을 바라봤어.

en: She watched over her mother all night.
She is used to staying up all night.
She aimed at the target.
She is no better than a thief.
She scratched her finger on a nail.
She took great pains to get the job done before the deadline.
She assisted her brother with his homework.
She helped her younger brother with his homework.
She was out of temper with her brother.
She got her brother to walk the dog.
She has a great affection for her little brothers.
She came into the garden and looked at the trees for a long time.
ko: 정원에 들어와서 한참 동안 나무들을 쳐다봤어.

en: She was walking along a garden path.
She weeded the garden.
She picked flowers in the garden.
She named all the flowers in the garden.
ko: 걔 정원에 있는 꽃들 이름 다 지어줬어.

en: She seeded vegetables in her garden.
ko: 걔 자기 정원에 채소 씨 뿌렸어.

en: She planted fragrant olives in the garden.
She stood in admiration of the garden.
ko: 걔 정원 보고 감탄하며 서 있었어.

en: She planted roses in the garden.
She found a ball in the garden.
She's in the garden planting roses.
She grows tomatoes in her garden.
She will do her best to be here on time.
ko: 걔 제시간에 오려고 최선을 다할 거야.

en: She goes to the dentist regularly, so she seldom gets toothache.
ko: 걔 치과 정기적으로 다녀서 치통이 거의 없어.

en: She visits the dentist on a regular basis, so she seldom gets toothaches.
ko: 걔 치과 꼬박꼬박 다녀서 이빨 아픈 일이 거의 없어.

en: She used to visit me regularly.
ko: 걔 예전에 나한테 자주 놀러 오곤 했어.

en: She has a habit of biting her nails.
She has a strong wish to work as an interpreter.
ko: 걔 통역사로 일하고 싶어 하는 마음이 되게 커.

en: She was engaged as an interpreter.
She didn't pass me without speaking to me.
ko: 걔 나한테 말도 안 걸고 그냥 지나가지는 않았어.

en: She was hit by a car while she was crossing the street.
She came across the street.
She crossed the street.
She smiled at me as she passed me in the street.
ko: 걔 길에서 나 지나칠 때 웃어줬어.

en: She is affected with the gout.
She gave a cry of pain.
She won't take an airplane for fear of a crash.
ko: 걔 추락할까 봐 무서워서 비행기 안 타.

en: She need not have kept silent.
ko: 걔 굳이 가만히 있을 필요 없었는데.

en: She made for the car right away.
She bought chicken.
She is keen on birds and flowers.
She wrote a book about the bird.
ko: 걔 그 새에 관한 책 썼어.

en: She wrote a book about birds.
She hung the cage from the eaves.
Is she equal to a long journey?
ko: 걔 장거리 여행 갈 수 있을까?

en: Does she have enough energy to take a long trip?
ko: 걔 장거리 여행 갈 체력이 될까?

en: Can she endure a long trip?
ko: 걔 장거리 여행 견딜 수 있어?

en: She ground down a kitchen knife in the course of many years.
She's been having trouble with back pain for years.
ko: 걔 몇 년째 허리 아파서 고생 중이야.

en: She lived a long life.
She is not accustomed to driving for a long time.
ko: 걔 운전 오래 하는 거 익숙하지 않아.

en: She was annoyed to be kept waiting.
ko: 걔 계속 기다려야 해서 짜증 났었어.

en: She was annoyed because she had been kept waiting.
She wore a long, loose coat.
She recovered from her long illness.
ko: 걔 오랫동안 앓던 병 다 나았어.

en: She stood on the deck with her long hair waving in the wind.
ko: 걔 긴 머리 휘날리며 갑판 위에 서 있었어.

en: She has long hair.
She has long feet.
She took a long time to choose her hat.
ko: 걔 모자 고르는 데 한참 걸렸어.

en: She stood waiting for me for a long time.
She died after she had been ill for a long time.
She was ill for a long time.
She looked as if she had been ill for a long time.
She was combing her hair for a long time.
She dwelled on the matter for a long time.
She had long blond hair.
She gazed at me for a long time.
She has been ill for a long time and she is still too weak to get about.
ko: 오랫동안 아파서 아직 돌아다니기엔 기운이 너무 없어.

en: She has suffered from bad headaches for a long time.
She had long been learning to play the piano.
She sings out of tune.
ko: 걔 노래 부를 때 음정이 다 틀려.

en: She observed how butterflies fly.
She repeated what she had heard to her mother.
ko: 자기가 들은 걸 엄마한테 그대로 말하더라.

en: She won't conform to the town's social patterns.
ko: 걔는 그 동네 분위기에 맞추려고 하질 않아.

en: She didn't like living in the city.
She left early in the morning.
She is a late riser.
She took a walk before breakfast.
She takes her dog to the park before breakfast.
ko: 아침 먹기 전에 강아지 데리고 공원 가.

en: She is in the habit of taking exercise before breakfast.
ko: 걔는 아침 먹기 전에 운동하는 습관이 있어.

en: She is in the habit of jogging before breakfast.
ko: 아침 먹기 전에 조깅하는 게 습관이야.

en: She had better eat breakfast.
ko: 아침 챙겨 먹는 게 좋을 거야.

en: She should eat breakfast.
She is getting breakfast ready.
She makes it a rule to read a newspaper after breakfast.
ko: 아침 먹고 신문 보는 게 걔 규칙이야.

en: She lays the table for breakfast.
She's setting the table for breakfast.
She missed the morning service.
She couldn't attend the morning church service.
ko: 오전 교회 예배에 참석을 못 했어.

en: She plays tennis in the morning.
She worked from morning till night.
She has been practicing the piano since morning.
She stood defiantly with arms akimbo.

en: She was a girl with finely chiseled features.

She tried to carry out her plan to save money.
She has a strong dislike of insects.
She is an outstanding poet.
She was careful opening the drawer.

ko: 그렇게 덜렁대서야 시험에 절대 합격 못 하지.

en: She was very well before lunch, but felt sick afterward.
ko: 점심 전까지만 해도 멀쩡하더니 먹고 나서 아프대.

en: I expect her to come back before lunch.
She's supposed to be back by lunch time.
She was in no humor for lunch.
She was not in the mood for lunch.
She didn't feel like eating lunch.
ko: 점심 먹을 생각이 별로 없나 봐.

en: She promised her father to be in time for lunch.
She got ready for lunch.

She helped cook lunch.
She's supposed to be back by lunchtime.

ko: 점심 먹으면서 한 시간 정도 쉬자고 하더라.

en: She spends three dollars a day for lunch and dinner.
ko: 걔는 점심이랑 저녁 먹는 데 하루에 3달러 써.

en: She is working night and day.

She is having lunch now.
She made her appearance around noon.

ko: 걔 추상화에 대해서 편견이 진짜 심해.

en: She is fair, fat and forty.
ko: 걔는 피부 좋고 살집 있는 마흔 살이야.

en: She's a middle-aged fat woman.
She is second to none when it comes to cooking Chinese food.
She is progressing in Chinese.
She is believed to be from China.

ko: 걔가 옷에다 돈을 다 쓸 정도로 철없진 않아.

en: She has brown eyes.
She was told off for being late.

ko: 걔 늦은 이유를 제대로 설명 못 하더라고.

en: She made an excuse for being late.
She hurried so she wouldn't be late.

ko: 걔 늦을 수도 있는데, 그러면 그냥 기다리지 뭐.

en: She didn't mention the reason for being late.
ko: 걔 늦은 이유를 말 안 하더라.

en: She excused herself for coming late.
She explained the reason why she was late.
She must come home by 9 at latest.
She glanced shyly at him.
She blushed with shame.
She bent her head in shame.
She is ashamed to speak to a foreigner.
She is shy and talks little.
ko: 걔 수줍음이 많아서 말을 잘 안 해.

en: She's shy and doesn't talk much.
ko: 걔 낯을 가려서 말을 많이 안 해.

en: She was not ashamed to ask me a question.
She turned away to hide her blushes.
ko: 걔 얼굴 빨개진 거 안 보여주려고 고개를 돌렸어.

en: She is ashamed to speak up.
ko: 걔 부끄러워서 말을 잘 못 해.

en: She stays calm through earthquakes.
She is a local government officer.
She favors quiet colors.
She likes subdued colors.
She works as a nurse in the local hospital.
She did it for the good of the community.
ko: 걔 지역 사회를 위해서 그 일을 했어.

en: She has traveled all over the globe.
She has a high grade of intelligence.

ko: 걔 근처 대학에서 야간 수업 몇 개 신청했어.

en: She assumed an air of indifference.

ko: 걔는 낯선 사람들이랑 있으면 잘 못 어울려.

en: She took the news calmly.
She was amazed to hear the news.
ko: 걔 그 소식 듣고 엄청 놀랐어.

en: She was surprised when she heard the news.
ko: 걔 그 소식 들었을 때 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: She was very surprised at the news.
ko: 걔 그 소식에 진짜 많이 놀랐어.

en: She's good at bargaining the price down.
ko: 걔 가격 깎는 거 진짜 잘해.

en: She is only too pleased to be advised by men.
ko: 걔는 남자들한테 조언 듣는 걸 너무 좋아해.

en: She was dressed fit to kill.
She was disguised in men's clothes.
She likes being looked at by boys.
She was not interested in boys at all.
She let go of the boy's hand.
She is very popular among the boys.
ko: 걔는 남자애들 사이에서 인기 진짜 많아.

en: She worked side by side with men.
She found a man dead.
She found a man injured.
She gave me an album as a birthday present.
She is a short story writer.
She invited us to her birthday party.
She likes short skirts.
She respects her homeroom teacher a lot.
She has great respect for her homeroom teacher.
She has great respect for her form teacher.
She has good control over her class.
Whomever she invites, she is kind.
Whomsoever she invites, she is quite hospitable.
ko: 걔는 누구를 초대하든 되게 잘 대해줘.

en: She likes nobody and nobody likes her.
ko: 걔는 아무도 안 좋아하고 아무도 걔를 안 좋아해.

en: She likes no one and no one likes her.
ko: 걔는 아무도 안 좋아하고 아무도 걔를 안 좋아해.

en: She firmly asserts that she will not sing in front of anybody.

en: She is coy with everyone.

She cleaned the house all by herself.
ko: 걔 혼자 집 청소 다 했어.

en: She was all kindness to everybody.
She was very kind to everyone.
She was kind to everybody.
She works as hard as anybody does.
She is gracious to everyone.

ko: 걔는 항상 모두에게 예의 바르게 행동해.

en: She has married nobody.
Who do you think she lives with?
Who is she?
Who's she?
She needs someone to talk to.

ko: 걔가 나한테 "누가 제일 먼저 왔어?"라고 물어봤어.

en: I wonder who she is.

ko: 걔는 선반에 있는 잡지를 잡으려고 손을 뻗었어.

en: She took down a book from the shelf.

en: She harbored the deserter.
She is an old hand at spying on tax evaders.
ko: 걔는 탈세자들 감시하는 데 도가 텄어.

en: She has a lot of faults. Still, I like her.
ko: 걔는 단점이 많지만 그래도 난 걔가 좋아.

en: She has many hobbies, cooking, knitting, gardening, collecting stamps, and so on.
ko: 걔는 요리, 뜨개질, 원예, 우표 수집 등 취미가 많아.

en: She knew it by a sixth sense.
She is another Madame Curie.

ko: 걔는 책을 많이 읽어서 수양을 쌓았어.

en: She turned away in horror at the sight of so much blood.
ko: 걔는 피를 너무 많이 보고 겁에 질려 고개를 돌렸어.

en: She was very busy.
She's been very busy.
She's a very strange person.
She is a woman of great literary ability.
She plays the violin very well.
She got quite well.
She is very fond of dogs.
She seemed to be very surprised.
She is very free with her money.
She looks very happy.
She reminds me very much of her mother.
ko: 그분 보면 어머니 생각이 많이 나요.

en: Such was her anger that she lost control of herself.

She called for help.
She managed to scare off her attacker by screaming loudly.
She cursed loudly.
She began to cry in a loud voice.

She was in a hurry to see the new baby.
ko: 아기를 빨리 보고 싶어서 서둘러 갔어.

en: She was delicate from birth.

She is not so much honest as clever.
I think that she's honest.

en: She was supposed to be here by noon.

ko: 걔 정오에는 거기 가 있어야 해.

en: Should she be there at noon?
She was released on the grounds that she was insane.

en: I am of the opinion that she is right.
ko: 내 생각엔 걔가 맞는 것 같아.

en: In my opinion, she is correct.

ko: 걔는 자기가 옳다고 믿는 대로 행동했어.

en: She was off in her Sunday best.
She is dressed in her best.

The older she grew, the more beautiful she become.

She grew up to be a lovely woman like her mother.
She's grown up to be a beautiful woman.
She grew up to be a beautiful lady.
She grew up to be a veterinarian.
She's grown out of her favorite dress, so her mother will have to make it over for her.

en: She grew up to be a great scientist.

en: She looked worried about her school report.
She died before coming of age.

She began to despair of success.
She has a cheerful disposition.
She has a cheerful personality.
She was unhappy for all her success.
She resembles her sister in character.
She resembles her father in character.

She traveled all over the world.
She set a new world record.
She is traveling around the world.
She has a great wish to travel around the world.

en: She is one of the best ballerinas in the world.
ko: 세계 최고의 발레리나 중 한 명이야.

en: She tries to keep up with what is going on in the world.

en: She has a soft and clear voice.

en: She has been studying French for a few years.
ko: 걔 프랑스어 공부한 지 몇 년 됐어.

en: She went on a journey a few days ago.

en: She squeezed the juice from several oranges.
ko: 걔 오렌지 몇 개 짜서 즙 냈어.

en: She is an expert in mathematics.

en: She was sad for the first time in months.

en: She broke with her family long ago.

en: She sank under the surface of the water.

en: She is second to none in swimming in her school.

en: She is good at swimming.

en: She detests speaking in public.

en: She hates speaking in public.

en: She doesn't like to speak in public.

en: She's no shrinking violet.

en: She has a negative attitude toward life.

en: She lost herself in the crowd.

en: She is a popular musician but very modest.

en: She is plain and stout as popular stars go.

en: She is a singer whose reputation is growing fast.

en: She is very human.

en: She is ill-natured.

en: She pushed her needle in and out.

en: She doubled over, clutching her side.

en: She is not only kind but honest.

ko: 걔는 친절을 베풀고도 아무런 보답도 못 받았어.

en: She was kind enough to show me the way.

en: She was kind enough to take me to the hospital.

en: She was kind enough to come pick me up at my house.

en: She kindly helped me with my homework.

en: She kindly showed me the way.

en: She was kind enough to give me good advice.

en: She has the kindness to lend me a good dictionary.

en: She was kind enough to accompany me to the station.

en: She had the kindness to take the lady to her home.

en: She kindly showed me around the city.

ko: 걔는 친절할 뿐 아니라 정직하기도 해.

en: She is more gentle than kind.

en: She was aware of her parents' eyes.

en: She doesn't believe in God.

en: She fell into a deep sleep.

en: She went outside to get a breath of fresh air.

en: She walked as far as Shinjuku.

en: She showed me her new car.

ko: 걔 새 모자 갖고 싶어 해.

en: She was wearing a new hat.
